SNetCreateGame.explanation:
ordinal: 101
SNetCreateGame creates a network game with the given multi player seed.

SNetDestroy.explanation:
ordinal: 102
SNetDestroy terminates the network provider.

SNetDropPlayer.explanation:
ordinal: 106
SNetDropPlayer drops the given player from the current game.

SNetGetGameInfo.explanation:
ordinal: 107
SNetGameInfo retrieves game information of the given type.

SNetGetOwnerTurnsWaiting.explanation:
ordinal: 110
SNetGetOwnerTurnsWaiting retrieves the number of anticipated turns.

SNetGetProviderCaps.explanation:
ordinal: 114
SNetGetProviderCaps retrieves network provider capacity information.

SNetGetTurnsInTransit.explanation:
ordinal: 115
SNetGetTurnsInTransit retrives the number of turns queued for sending over
the network.

SNetInitializeProvider.explanation:
ordinal: 117
SNetInitializeProvider initializes the network provider.

SNetLeaveGame.explanation:
ordinal: 119
SNetLeaveGame notifies all connected peers that the client has left the game.

SNetPerformUpgrade.explanation:
ordinal: 120
SNetPerformUpgrade performs a network upgrade of the game.

SNetReceiveMessage.explanation:
ordinal: 121
SNetReceiveMessage receives a network message from a connected peer.

SNetReceiveTurns.explanation:
ordinal: 122
SNetReceiveTurns receives turns and player states from all connected peers.

SNetRegisterEventHandler.explanation:
ordinal: 123
SNetRegisterEventHandler registers the event handler for the given event
type.

SNetSendMessage.explanation:
ordinal: 127
SNetSendMessage sends a network message to the given player.

SNetSendTurn.explanation:
ordinal: 128
SNetSendTurn sends the given turn to all connected peers.

SNetSetBasePlayer.explanation:
ordinal: 129
SNetSetBasePlayer sets the base player number of the network provider.

SNetUnregisterEventHandler.explanation:
ordinal: 131
SNetUnregisterEventHandler unregisters the event handler of the given event
type.

SNetSendServerChatCommand.explanation:
ordinal: 134
SNetSendServerChatCommand sends a chat command to the server.

SFileCloseArchive.explanation:
ordinal: 252
SFileCloseArchive closes the given MPQ archive.

SFileCloseFile.explanation:
ordinal: 253
SFileCloseFile closes the given file.

SFileDdaBeginEx.explanation:
ordinal: 255
SFileDdaBeginEx starts playback of the given audio stream.

SFileDdaDestroy.explanation:
ordinal: 256
SFileDdaDestroy terminates the sound subsystem.

SFileDdaEnd.explanation:
ordinal: 257
SFileDdaEnd stops playback of the given audio stream.

ordinal: 258

SFileDdaSetVolume.explanation:

SFileGetFileSize.explanation:
ordinal: 265
SFileGetFileSize returns the size of the given file.

SFileOpenArchive.explanation:
ordinal: 266
SFileOpenArchive opens the named MPQ archive and retrieves its file
descriptor.

SFileOpenFile.explanation:
ordinal: 267
SFileOpenFile opens the named file and retrieves its file descriptor.

SFileOpenFileEx.explanation:
ordinal: 268
SFileOpenFileEx opens the named file of the given MPQ archive, and retrieves
its file descriptor.

SFileReadFile.explanation:
ordinal: 269
SFileReadFile reads the specifies number of bytes from the given file.

SFileSetBasePath.explanation:
ordinal: 270
SFileSetBasePath sets the base directory for relative file operations. In
practice, it is set to the game directory.

SFileSetFilePointer.explanation:
ordinal: 271
SFileSetFilePointer seeks to the given offset within file. If whence is set
to SEEK_SET, SEEK_CUR, or SEEK_END, the offset is relative to the start of
the file, the current position indicator, or end-of-file, respectively.

appfat_get_error_string.explanation:
appfat_get_error_string returns a formatted error message based on the given
error code.

appfat_get_DD_error_string.explanation:
appfat_get_DD_error_string stores a formatted error message in error_buf
based on the given DirectDraw error code.

appfat_get_DS_error_string.explanation:
appfat_get_DS_error_string stores a formatted error message in error_buf
based on the given DirectSound error code.

appfat_get_last_error.explanation: appfat_get_last_error returns a formatted error message of the last error.

appfat_terminate_message_box.explanation:
appfat_terminate_message_box terminates the game and displays an error
message box.

appfat_message_box.explanation:
appfat_message_box displays an error message box based on the given format
string and variable argument list.

appfat_cleanup.explanation: appfat_cleanup cleans up after a fatal application error.

appfat_draw_message_box.explanation:
appfat_draw_message_box renders an in-game message box with the given text
on screen.

appfat_DD_assert.explanation: appfat_DD_assert terminates the game with a DirectDraw assertion message box.

appfat_DS_assert.explanation:
appfat_DS_assert terminates the game with a DirectSound assertion message
box.

appfat_centre_dialog_box.explanation: appfat_centre_dialog_box centres the given dialog box.

appfat_terminate_dialog_box.explanation:
appfat_terminate_dialog_box terminates the game and displays an error dialog
box based on the given template id.

appfat_dialog_func.explanation:
appfat_dialog_func is a callback function which processes messages sent to
the given dialog box.

appfat_set_dialog_text.explanation: appfat_set_dialog_text sets the text of the given dialog.

appfat_dialog_box.explanation:
appfat_dialog_box displays an error dialog box based on the given template id
and error code.

appfat_terminate_file_error_dialog.explanation:
appfat_terminate_file_error_dialog terminates the game with a file not found
error dialog.

appfat_terminate_disk_space_error_dialog.explanation:
appfat_terminate_disk_space_error_dialog terminates the game with an out of
disk space error dialog.

appfat_terminate_insert_cd_error_dialog.explanation:
appfat_terminate_insert_cd_error_dialog terminates the game with an insert CD
error dialog.

appfat_terminate_directory_error_dialog.explanation:
appfat_terminate_directory_error_dialog terminates the game with a read-only
directory error dialog.

automap_init_types.explanation: automap_init_types loads the mapping between tile IDs and automap types.

automap_scroll_right.explanation: automap_scroll_right scrolls the automap to the right.

automap_zoom_out.explanation: automap_zoom_out decreases the zoom level of the automap.

automap_draw.explanation: automap_draw renders the automap on screen.

automap_draw_type.explanation:
automap_draw_type renders the given automap type at the specified screen
coordinates.
x = screen_x - 64
y = screen_y - 160

level, and in multi player, the name of the game and the game password.

automap_set_view.explanation: automap_set_view marks the given coordinate as within view on the automap.

automap_reset_zoom.explanation: automap_reset_zoom resets the zoom level of the automap.

capture_screenshot.explanation:
capture_screenshot captures a screenshot and stores it within the game
directory as "screenXX.pcx". While the screenshot is being taken, the game is
paused temporarily as indicated by the red screen.

capture_write_pcx_hdr.explanation:
capture_write_pcx_hdr writes a PCX header with the specified image dimensions
to the file.

capture_rle_encode.explanation: capture_rle_encode RLE encodes the pixels of the source buffer.

capture_create_file.explanation: capture_create_file creates a new PCX file with the pattern "screenXX.PCX".

capture_set_red_palette.explanation: capture_set_red_palette sets the palette to red-scale.

of bytes decoded.

input buffer of length n.

codec_encode.explanation: codec_encode encodes the given memory buffer in-place.

items_get_rand_loot_id_from_monster.explanation:
items_get_rand_loot_id_from_monster returns the loot ID of a random item
drop from the monster.
The loot ID is positive for regular items and negative for unique items, as
further described by the following pseudo-code.
switch {
case loot_id > 0:
/// regular item drop.
item_id = loot_id - 1
case loot_id < 0:
/// unique item drop.
unique_item_id = -loot_id - 1
case loot_id == 0:
/// no item drop.
}
The drops are calculated as follows.
* Winged Fiends (i.e. Fiend, Blink, Gloom and Familiar) never drop items.
* The Butcher always drops The Butcher's Cleaver.
* Skeleton King always drops The Undead Crown.
1) rnd(100) > 40: no drop
2) rnd(100) > 25: drop gold
3) Drop a random item with qlvl <= mlvl
- The drop rate of an item determines if it has non-existant, regular
or double chance of dropping.
